bibl.title: The Investigation of the Ancient Wall Extending from Aswan to Philae. Second Preliminary Report. With a Contribution on the Pottery from the Watch-Tower at Tell Asmar.
bibl.note: Indications of use of the portage road during the Ptolemaic period are scarce. Studying the pottery collected from the vicinity of the watch-tower at Tell Asmar, we learn that this control system was particularly active during early Imperial times.
bibl.seg: JARITZ Horst, The Investigation of the Ancient Wall Extending from Aswan to Philae. Second Preliminary Report. With a Contribution on the Pottery from the Watch-Tower at Tell Asmar.

Indications of use of the portage road during the Ptolemaic period are scarce. Studying the pottery collected from the vicinity of the watch-tower at Tell Asmar, we learn that this control system was particularly active during early Imperial times.
